arts.ttl: Dave Challinor allays Birmingham City fears as Chris Davies' team loses League One leadership
arts.sum: Dave Challinor insists Birmingham City are still ‘the best team in the league’ despite holding Blues to a draw and costing them their place at the top of the table. Blues left Edgeley Park slightly grateful to have held on to a 1-1 draw and after a second half examination in which their promotion credentials were severely tested.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City dealt Keshi Anderson and Emil Hansson injury blows
arts.sum: Birmingham City will be without wide players Keshi Anderson and Emil Hansson for at least ‘a few weeks’ according to Chris Davies. Davies added: “But with Scott coming back, he got half-an-hour there having not played for two months, it’s going to take him time.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City should sanction loan transfer if Davies doesn't change his mind
arts.sum: With injuries mounting in Blues' wide department once more, Yokoyama could be the only natural winger available to Davies for the New Year's Day game at Stockport County. Yokoyama has started all four games in the Vertu Trophy and played in the FA Cup win at Blackpool.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies explains what he wanted Birmingham City to do better in Stockport draw
arts.sum: Chris Davies lamented Birmingham City’s failure to exploit the counter-attacking spaces during Stockport’s second half onslaught in their draw at Edgeley Park. From our point of view, there was space in behind their midfield and we needed to be clearer and win chances from counter-attacks.

arts.ttl: Macauley Southam-Hales rescues point for Stockport
Wayne Rooney speaks out as former Birmingham City boss leaves Plymouth Argyle
arts.sum: “Thanks also to all the staff who made me feel welcome and who make the club such a special place, the players and fans for their efforts and support during my time as Head Coach and I wish them all the best for the future. Plymouth confirmed his departure in a statement which read: “Plymouth Argyle can confirm that the club and Head Coach Wayne Rooney have mutually agreed to part ways with immediate effect.

arts.ttl: New Year's Day's League One predictions including Stockport County vs. Birmingham City
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's League One fixtures, including Stockport County vs. Birmingham City.

arts.ttl: Louie Barry makes Birmingham City wish clear after Aston Villa’s unique transfer decision
arts.sum: League One’s 15-goal top scorer will play his final game on loan for Stockport against Blues on New Year’s Day after being recalled by Aston Villa. Stockport have won seven of their 11 games at Edgeley Park to give themselves one of the best home records in League One, but their away form is proving detrimental to their promotion hopes.

arts.ttl: Supercomputer reveals Wrexham, Birmingham City and Wycombe's League One promotion fate
arts.sum: A supercomputer has predicted the final League One table - and it's bad news for Ryan Reynolds' Wrexham

arts.ttl: ‘Dropped points’ – Stockport County vs Birmingham City prediction: The72
arts.sum: The72's writers offer their Stockport County vs Birmingham City prediction ahead of the League One clash on New Years' Day. The post ‘Dropped points’ – Stockport County vs Birmingham City prediction: The72 appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
